results.title: Houdini never died
results.brief_description: Examines the pervasive influence of Houdini on magicans throughout the world. Contains rare footage of Houdini and shows other noted magicans at work. Narrated by Burgess Meredith.

results.title: Hotel New York
results.brief_description: This is the final version of “New York” shown by Jackie Raynal in 1980 as a work-in-progress. It is the story of Loulou Blanchot, a French filmmaker who decides to live in New York after having been invited to show one of her films there. Loulou begins to get acquainted with the city and gets a job as an editor for a porno film company.

results.title: Host
results.brief_description: Lucas states: In this video, I participate in an on-line therapy session directed by the system operator of a streetside multi-media kiosk. As I indulge in a virtual conversation about a troublesome relationship, the session instantly becomes an amalgamation of daytime television and tabloid, wherein the surveillance camera becomes the eye of the media.

results.title: Hospitals and everything like that
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fears of the hospitalisation process. Follows a young girl suffering from an asthmatic complaint as she checks into the hospital and is given routine check-ups and special tests. Shows the sympathetic and supportive nature of the hospital staff. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Hospital school
results.brief_description: At the Lord Mayor Treloar Cripples Hospital and College every facility for the treatment, education and vocational training of physically handicapped children is provided. This film shows the observation ward, the X-ray department, the operating theatres, the massage and exercise room, and the bright airy wards and sunny terraces where the children’s schooling takes place simultaneously with their medical treatment.

results.title: Horse talk
results.creator_credit: Paul Barralet and Paul Barralet Productions
results.brief_description: The various ways in which the horse still plays an active part in British life. Dray horses, horses on the farm, thoroughbreds and ponies for sport, and many others. The ceremonial horse being trained for the intricate pattern of ancient customs and great occasions which are part of Britain’s tradition. Commentary by James McKechnie.

results.title: Horse flickers
results.creator_credit: Bill Stitt, Rhonda Raulston, Jim Gruebel and Bill Stitt Productions
results.brief_description: Non-narrated children’s film in which a series of images of horses comes to life on a barn floor. They are composed of feathers and spangles, newspapers and sleeping bags, human beings and broomsticks and combine imagination, humour, whimsy and art. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
